page.title: 10FOREST OF DEAN CEMETERY
page.content: YEW TREE BREAK CEMETERY WAS OPENED IN 1957 BY CINDERFORD PARISH COUNCIL. AS IT IS 2 MILES FROM CINDERFORD THERE IS A BUS SERVICE. IT COVERS 10 ACRES AND IS HALF FULL. THERE IS A SECTION FOR BAPTISTS, CHURCH OF ENGLAND & ROMAN CATHOLICS. THERE IS AN AREA FOR CREMATION ASHES & A GARDEN OF REMEMBERANCE. A CHAPEL IS AVAILABLE. ONE OF THE GRAVES IS OF A 19 YEAR OLD LAD KILLED IN THE FALKLANDS WAR. THE CARETAKER EARNS Â£57. AFTER STOPPAGES BUT HAS THE USE OF A HOUSE. HE CUTS THE GRASS ONCE A WEEK BY PETROL MOWER. SOME WEEKS HE MAY DEAL WITH ONLY TWO FUNERALS. A HEADSTONE COSTS Â£200+. MANY GRAVES HAVE FLOWERS. THERE IS NO LITTER BUT SOME VANDALISM.
